comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: Another of these pics of Brisbane which have passed under my radar...as with a few of the others, I'm not convinced that this pic involves the 1893 floods or aftermath. In this pic the Brisbane River looks to be within its normal tidal range, so it wasn't taken during the flood...and my hunch (guess!) is there's not enough mayhem evident for the pic to have been taken in the weeks and probably months following the 1893 floods. Hitherto I haven't quite given these pics of Brisbane the attention which is their due...but I suspect that if we dig around we might be able to date pre and post 1893 flood pics via less substantial structures such as waterfront warehouses and sheds, which might not have survived major flooding...but I suspect flood dating will complicated by other floods...eg, the 1890, 1896 and 1898 floods...which although not in the same league as the 1893 floods were still significant...as can be seen here www.flickr.com/photos/33147718@N05/7283001522/in/photolis...

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: www.archivessearch.qld.gov.au/Image/DigitalImageView.aspx... ...this fantastic QSA panorama/wide angle shot shows the river level at the Brisbane Customs House during the 1893 floods. I suspect it even shows a sludge line across the Customs House which indicates the high point of the flood. nla.gov.au/nla.news-page5321224 here's 1899 (no flood)

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] Hmmm, it appears just the title of this image was entered incorrectly, the captions in our database records also don't indicate that it was taken during the floods so it must have been titled incorrectly. Thanks for alerting us quasymody, bit of an oops on our part :) 
P.S. That trove article is brilliant, great photographs!
